leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 数值相对论与宇宙尺度计算物理生态
leaf_cluster.typical_objects: 时空度规/曲率, 引力波波形, N-body/LSS, 宇宙学网格场
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 建模→高精仿真→波形/统计→推断→benchmark
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 专用仿真器 + 波形/后处理 + 推断/采样 + HPC

unit.unit_name: 宇宙学N-body与大尺度结构模拟生态
unit.coverage_tools: N-body codes、初始条件、halo finding、并行

queries: [WEB] large scale structure analysis python github

tools.name: 21cmFAST
tools.one_line_profile: Fast semi-numerical simulation code for the cosmological 21cm signal
tools.detailed_description: A powerful semi-numerical code designed to simulate the cosmological 21cm signal from the Epoch of Reionization (EoR) and Cosmic Dawn. It efficiently generates 3D realizations of evolved density, ionization, peculiar velocity, and spin temperature fields.

tools.name: Nyx
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive mesh N-body and hydro cosmological simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A massively parallel, adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) code for simulating cosmological structure formation. It solves equations for dark matter (N-body) and baryonic gas (hydrodynamics) expansion in an expanding universe.

tools.name: pttools
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation software for phase transitions in the early universe
tools.detailed_description: A specialized tool for simulating and analyzing phase transitions in the early universe context, likely supporting calculations related to gravitational waves or bubble nucleation.

tools.name: ecosmog-cvg
tools.one_line_profile: N-body code for cosmological structure formation in cubic vector Galileon gravity
tools.detailed_description: A specialized N-body simulation code designed to study structure formation under Modified Gravity theories, specifically Cubic Vector Galileon gravity.

tools.name: Cosmoglobe
tools.one_line_profile: Astrophysical sky simulation package based on Commander results
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for producing astrophysical sky simulations directly from Commander results, supporting the Cosmoglobe sky model project.

tools.name: JaxPM
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-powered Cosmological Particle-Mesh N-body Solver
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable cosmological Particle-Mesh (PM) N-body solver implemented in JAX, enabling gradient-based optimization and inference for cosmological simulations.

tools.name: flowpm
tools.one_line_profile: Particle Mesh simulation in TensorFlow
tools.detailed_description: A TensorFlow-based implementation of Particle Mesh (PM) N-body simulation, designed for differentiable cosmological simulations and large-scale structure analysis.

tools.name: HACCabana
tools.one_line_profile: N-body cosmology proxy application based on Cabana
tools.detailed_description: A proxy application for the HACC (Hardware/Hybrid Accelerated Cosmology Code) N-body simulation framework, utilizing the Cabana library for performance portability on exascale systems.

tools.name: EXP-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for cosmological and external simulations
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools developed for processing and analyzing cosmological simulations, likely associated with the EXP simulation code ecosystem.

tools.name: JULIA-Enzo-Tools
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of Julia programs for postprocessing Enzo cosmological simulation data
tools.detailed_description: A set of Julia scripts and tools designed for the analysis and post-processing of grid-based astrophysical simulation data, specifically tailored for the Enzo code.

tools.name: MG-PICOLA
tools.one_line_profile: COLA-based cosmological simulation code for modified gravity and massive neutrinos
tools.detailed_description: A modified version of the L-PICOLA code that extends the COLA (COmoving Lagrangian Acceleration) approach to simulate cosmological structure formation in theories with scale-dependent growth and massive neutrinos. Includes on-the-fly halo finding.

tools.name: J-Gravity
tools.one_line_profile: Cosmological scale particle simulator for the Janus Cosmological Model
tools.detailed_description: A cosmological N-body particle simulator designed to test the Janus Cosmological Model. It features a distributed architecture with a dispatcher, OpenCL-accelerated workers, and a renderer for visualization.

tools.name: PyFPT
tools.one_line_profile: Stochastic first-passage time simulations for inflationary cosmology
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for calculating the probability density function of the first-passage time of stochastic processes using importance sampling, primarily designed for studying the statistics of e-folds during cosmic inflation.

tools.name: CosmoMMF
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for analyzing baryonic effects on cosmological structures
tools.detailed_description: A Nexus Pipeline designed to analyze the effects of baryonic matter on cosmological structures within the IllustrisTNG simulations, focusing on identifying and characterizing cosmic web filaments and nodes.

tools.name: jaxion
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-powered simulation library for fuzzy dark matter and astrophysical dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A simulation library built on JAX for performing numerical experiments involving fuzzy dark matter, stars, and gas. Leverages JAX's autodiff and compilation features for efficient astrophysical modeling.

tools.name: Zeus21
tools.one_line_profile: Fast simulations of cosmic dawn and 21cm signal
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for rapid simulation of the cosmic dawn and the 21-cm hydrogen line signal, enabling efficient parameter space exploration for early universe cosmology.

tools.name: HBT+
tools.one_line_profile: Subhalo finder and merger tree builder for cosmological simulations
tools.detailed_description: A hierarchical bound-tracing code for identifying subhalos and building merger trees in cosmological N-body simulations, designed to handle complex substructures robustly.

tools.name: ldmx-sw
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation and reconstruction framework for the Light Dark Matter eXperiment
tools.detailed_description: The software framework for the Light Dark Matter eXperiment (LDMX), providing tools for detector simulation (Geant4-based) and event reconstruction to search for light dark matter signatures.

tools.name: BlendingToolKit
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for creating blend catalogs and metrics for LSST/Rubin Observatory
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit designed for the Large Synoptic Survey Telescope (LSST) Dark Energy Science Collaboration to generate blended galaxy images, produce training samples, and evaluate deblending algorithms.

tools.name: imSim
tools.one_line_profile: Rubin Observatory image simulation package based on GalSim
tools.detailed_description: The official image simulation package for the Rubin Observatory (LSST), built upon GalSim to produce high-fidelity simulated astronomical images for pipeline testing and validation.

tools.name: GadgetIO.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia library for reading and writing Gadget simulation data
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing efficient binary I/O operations for the Gadget cosmological Tree-SPH simulation code formats (1, 2, and HDF5).

tools.name: pmesh
tools.one_line_profile: Particle Mesh calculation library in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for performing Particle-Mesh (PM) calculations, essential for cosmological N-body simulations and field analysis. It supports parallel computing and is part of the MP-Gadget ecosystem.

tools.name: Mera.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis and visualization tool for astrophysical simulation data
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for analyzing and visualizing data from astrophysical simulations (primarily Ramses), offering high-level interfaces for data inspection and projection.

tools.name: FishLSS
tools.one_line_profile: Fisher forecasting code for Large Scale Structure surveys
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool for performing Fisher matrix forecasting for Large Scale Structure (LSS) surveys. It utilizes Lagrangian Perturbation Theory to model the cosmological observables and estimate parameter constraints.

tools.name: ORNL-Molecular-Datasets-Workflow
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed workflow for large-scale molecular dataset generation and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A distributed computing workflow designed for the generation and analysis of large-scale molecular datasets. It supports multi-source, multi-fidelity quantum chemical calculations for ground-state and excited-state properties, facilitating high-throughput molecular screening.

tools.name: PHARE
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Hybrid Particle-In-Cell code with Adaptive Mesh Refinement
tools.detailed_description: A parallel hybrid Particle-In-Cell (PIC) simulation code featuring Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR). It is designed for modeling plasma physics phenomena where kinetic ion effects are important, utilizing a hybrid fluid-kinetic approach.

tools.name: PPM Library
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Particle Mesh library for transparent parallelization
tools.detailed_description: The Parallel Particle Mesh (PPM) library serves as a middleware for particle-mesh simulations. It provides transparent parallelization capabilities, abstracting the complexities of domain decomposition and communication for particle-based scientific codes.

tools.name: COVMOS
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation of cosmic object catalogues in real and redshift space
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python library for rapidly simulating catalogues of cosmic objects. It handles both real and redshift space distributions, enabling the generation of mock catalogs for cosmological surveys and statistical analysis.

tools.name: Nyxus
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable image feature extraction library for bioimaging
tools.detailed_description: A robust and scalable library for extracting features from images, particularly suited for large-scale bioimaging datasets. It computes a wide range of intensity, texture, and shape features for cellular analysis.

tools.name: pumi-pic
tools.one_line_profile: Support libraries for unstructured mesh PIC simulations
tools.detailed_description: A library supporting Particle-In-Cell (PIC) simulations on unstructured meshes. It is optimized for both GPUs and CPUs, providing essential data structures and algorithms for managing mesh-particle interactions in complex geometries.

tools.name: SplatCo
tools.one_line_profile: Structure-View Collaborative Gaussian Splatting for scene rendering
tools.detailed_description: A computer vision tool implementing Structure-View Collaborative Gaussian Splatting. It is designed for detail-preserving rendering of large-scale unbounded scenes, useful for 3D reconstruction and visualization tasks.

tools.name: HBT-HERONS
tools.one_line_profile: History-based subhalo finder for cosmological simulations
tools.detailed_description: A subhalo finding algorithm that tracks the evolutionary history of halos in dark-matter-only and hydrodynamical simulations. It is designed to robustly identify substructures within large-scale cosmological N-body simulations.

tools.name: SOAP
tools.one_line_profile: Spherical Overdensity Aperture Processor for halo properties
tools.detailed_description: An MPI-parallelized Python tool for computing halo properties in SWIFT N-body simulations using the Spherical Overdensity definition. It processes simulation outputs to derive physical characteristics of dark matter halos.

tools.name: SWIFT
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance gravity and hydrodynamics solver for cosmology
tools.detailed_description: A modern, high-performance simulation code for astrophysics and cosmology. It employs a task-based parallelism model to solve gravity (N-body) and hydrodynamics (SPH) equations, optimized for large-scale supercomputing clusters.

tools.name: swift-emulator
tools.one_line_profile: Cosmological emulator for SWIFT simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based emulator designed to predict the outcomes of SWIFT cosmological simulations. It allows for rapid exploration of parameter space by approximating the simulation results without running full computationally expensive simulations.

tools.name: swiftsimio
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for reading and visualizing SWIFT simulation data
tools.detailed_description: A Python ecosystem library designed for reading, manipulating, and visualizing data produced by the SWIFT cosmological simulation code. It leverages unyt for unit consistency and h5py for efficient I/O, streamlining the post-processing workflow for large-scale hydrodynamical simulations.

tools.name: MiraTitanHMFemulator
tools.one_line_profile: Emulator for the halo mass function from Mira-Titan simulations
tools.detailed_description: A high-precision emulator for the Halo Mass Function (HMF) derived from the Mira-Titan Universe suite of N-body simulations. It allows for rapid and accurate prediction of cosmological structure statistics across a range of cosmological parameters.

tools.name: Shamrock
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-GPU hydrodynamics framework for astrophysics
tools.detailed_description: An open-source, multi-GPU hydrodynamics framework designed for astrophysical simulations. It supports Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) and Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR), capable of scaling from local workstations to exascale supercomputers.

tools.name: MPI-Rockstar
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel implementation of the Rockstar Halo Finder
tools.detailed_description: A hybrid MPI and OpenMP parallel implementation of the Rockstar phase-space halo finder. It is designed to efficiently identify dark matter halos and substructures in large-scale cosmological N-body simulations running on high-performance computing clusters.

tools.name: XGPaint.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation of extragalactic foregrounds for CMB experiments
tools.detailed_description: A Julia-based simulation package for generating fast-forward simulations of extragalactic foregrounds, such as the Cosmic Infrared Background (CIB) and radio galaxies, primarily for use in Cosmic Microwave Background (CMB) analysis.

tools.name: PaCMAP
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale dimensionality reduction technique
tools.detailed_description: PaCMAP (Pairwise Controlled Manifold Approximation) is a dimensionality reduction technique that preserves both global and local structure in high-dimensional data. It is widely used in scientific data analysis for visualizing complex datasets.

tools.name: zeldovich-PLT
tools.one_line_profile: Initial conditions generator for cosmological N-body simulations
tools.detailed_description: A tool for generating initial conditions for cosmological N-body simulations. It optionally applies Particle Linear Theory (PLT) corrections to improve the accuracy of the simulation transients at early times.

tools.name: Py-SPHViewer
tools.one_line_profile: SPH rendering framework for cosmological simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for rendering and visualizing data from cosmological simulations using the Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) scheme. It allows for the creation of high-quality density fields and images from particle data.

tools.name: pyhalomodel
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of the halo model for power spectra
tools.detailed_description: A pure Python library implementing the halo model for calculating power spectra of any large-scale structure tracer combination. It is useful for theoretical modeling and analysis of cosmological clustering.

tools.name: grav_sim
tools.one_line_profile: N-body gravity simulation library
tools.detailed_description: A library for N-body gravity simulations providing both C and Python APIs. It allows for the integration of gravitational dynamics, suitable for research or educational demonstrations of orbital mechanics and cluster dynamics.

tools.name: helPME
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Particle Mesh Ewald (PME) library
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing the Particle Mesh Ewald (PME) method for efficient calculation of long-range interactions (gravity or electrostatics) in particle-based simulations. It is designed to be integrated into larger simulation codes.

tools.name: Mangrove
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Neural Networks for predicting baryonic properties from dark matter merger trees
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning tool that uses Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) to regress and predict baryonic properties of galaxies directly from full dark matter merger trees, aiding in the analysis of galaxy formation simulations.

tools.name: Halotools
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for modeling the galaxy-halo connection and large-scale structure
tools.detailed_description: A specialized Python package for studying large-scale structure, cosmology, and galaxy evolution using N-body simulations and halo models. It provides a modular platform for creating mock galaxy catalogs and analyzing their statistical properties.

tools.name: AxioNyx
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation code for Fuzzy Dark Matter (FDM) dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A publicly available code designed for performing simulations of Fuzzy Dark Matter (FDM), also known as Ultralight Axion Dark Matter, solving the Schrödinger-Poisson equations for cosmological structures.

tools.name: nbodykit
tools.one_line_profile: Massively parallel analysis kit for large-scale structure datasets
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for analyzing large-scale structure (LSS) datasets from N-body simulations and observational surveys. It supports massively parallel processing using MPI and provides algorithms for correlation functions, power spectra, and other cosmological statistics.

tools.name: jFoF
tools.one_line_profile: JAX implementation of Friends-of-Friends (FoF) halo finder
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable implementation of the Friends-of-Friends (FoF) halo finding algorithm using JAX, enabling gradient-based optimization and analysis in cosmological N-body simulations.

tools.name: pv-meshless
tools.one_line_profile: ParaView plugin for visualizing particle/meshless datasets
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for ParaView designed to handle and visualize particle-based or meshless datasets, commonly used in SPH (Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics) and N-body cosmological simulations.

tools.name: scida
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable analysis tool for large scientific datasets in astrophysics
tools.detailed_description: An analysis tool designed for large scientific datasets, primarily serving the astrophysics community. It supports cosmological and galaxy formation simulations (particles or unstructured meshes) and uses Dask for scalable, out-of-core computation.

tools.name: DISCO-DJ
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Simulations for Cosmology using JAX
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable cosmological simulation code implemented in JAX, allowing for gradient-based optimization and inference of cosmological parameters and initial conditions.

tools.name: MUSIC2
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-scale initial conditions generator for cosmological simulations
tools.detailed_description: The second version of the MUSIC code, designed to generate multi-scale initial conditions for cosmological N-body and hydrodynamical simulations, supporting zoom-in setups and various transfer functions.

tools.name: monofonIC
tools.one_line_profile: High-order LPT/PPT cosmological initial conditions generator
tools.detailed_description: A code for generating cosmological initial conditions using high-order Lagrangian Perturbation Theory (LPT) and Particle Perturbation Theory (PPT), suitable for single-resolution cosmological simulations.

tools.name: cosmograph
tools.one_line_profile: Cosmological General Relativity and Hydrodynamics simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A simulation code that integrates Cosmological General Relativity with Perfect Fluid or Particle Hydrodynamics, designed for studying relativistic effects in large-scale structure formation.

tools.name: csstemu
tools.one_line_profile: Cosmological emulator for CSST statistics prediction
tools.detailed_description: A Python package serving as a cosmological emulator for the China Space Station Telescope (CSST), designed to predict various cosmological statistics efficiently without running full simulations.

tools.name: Gotham_Web
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for hydrodynamic simulations and cosmic web analysis
tools.detailed_description: A modular Python toolkit for analyzing hydrodynamic simulations and spectroscopic galaxy surveys. It focuses on cosmic web characterization, statistical data analysis, and HPC-friendly workflows.

tools.name: pyHalo
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for rendering dark matter halo populations for lensing
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit for generating and rendering populations of dark matter halos, specifically designed for gravitational lensing simulations and substructure analysis.

tools.name: ArepoVTK
tools.one_line_profile: Ray-tracing Voronoi tessellation volume renderer for AREPO
tools.detailed_description: A visualization toolkit specifically designed for the AREPO moving-mesh code. It performs ray-tracing volume rendering directly on the Voronoi tessellation used by AREPO simulations.

tools.name: AREPO
tools.one_line_profile: Moving-mesh code for cosmological and galaxy formation simulations
tools.detailed_description: The public version of the AREPO code, a massively parallel moving-mesh hydrodynamical code used for large-scale structure and galaxy formation simulations. It combines the advantages of finite volume hydrodynamics with the flexibility of Lagrangian particle methods.

tools.name: pmwd
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable cosmological particle-mesh N-body solver
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable cosmological forward model based on the particle-mesh (PM) method, enabling gradient-based inference and optimization for cosmological parameters.

tools.name: StePS
tools.one_line_profile: Stereographically projected cosmological simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A code for running cosmological simulations using stereographic projection to model infinite universes with compact topology.

tools.name: Enzo
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive mesh refinement code for astrophysics and cosmology
tools.detailed_description: A community-developed adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) simulation code, designed for rich, multi-physics hydrodynamic astrophysical calculations including cosmology, star formation, and turbulence.

tools.name: Enzo-E
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale-ready version of the Enzo simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A rewrite of the Enzo adaptive mesh refinement code using Charm++ to enable scalability to exascale computing platforms for cosmological and astrophysical simulations.

tools.name: FastPM
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable N-body Particle Mesh solver
tools.detailed_description: A fast and scalable Particle-Mesh (PM) N-body solver designed for approximate cosmological simulations and mock catalog generation.

tools.name: Quijote-simulations
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for the Quijote N-body simulation suite
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts and tools to read, analyze, and process data from the Quijote suite of cosmological N-body simulations, including power spectrum and bispectrum calculations.

tools.name: Janus-CUDA-Nbody
tools.one_line_profile: CUDA N-body simulation for Janus Cosmological Model
tools.detailed_description: A CUDA-accelerated N-body simulation code specifically modified to simulate the Janus Cosmological Model (JCM) involving positive and negative mass interactions.

tools.name: PySM 3
tools.one_line_profile: Sky emission simulations for CMB experiments
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for generating full-sky simulations of Galactic foreground emission and Cosmic Microwave Background (CMB) signals, used for instrument modeling and data analysis.

tools.name: LibGeoDecomp
tools.one_line_profile: Library for parallelizing stencil and particle simulations
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for parallelizing computer simulations (stencil codes, mesh-free methods, N-body) on heterogeneous HPC architectures.

tools.name: libmrc
tools.one_line_profile: Infrastructure library for mesh and particle-in-cell codes
tools.detailed_description: A computational library providing domain decomposition, mesh management, and I/O support for structured mesh and particle-in-cell (PIC) simulation codes.

tools.name: gevolution
tools.one_line_profile: Relativistic cosmological N-body code
tools.detailed_description: A cosmological N-body code that solves the Einstein field equations in the weak field limit, allowing for the simulation of general relativistic effects in large scale structure formation.

tools.name: gevolution (v1.2)
tools.one_line_profile: Relativistic cosmological N-body code (v1.2)
tools.detailed_description: Updated version of the gevolution code for relativistic cosmological N-body simulations, including features for ray tracing and light cone generation.

tools.name: Ginnungagap
tools.one_line_profile: Initial conditions generator for cosmological simulations
tools.detailed_description: A tool for generating initial conditions for cosmological N-body simulations, supporting various input power spectra and output formats.

tools.name: GLASS
tools.one_line_profile: Generator for Large Scale Structure
tools.detailed_description: A code for generating random realizations of cosmological Large Scale Structure (LSS) and weak lensing fields on the sphere.

tools.name: cosmogrb
tools.one_line_profile: Cosmological Gamma-Ray Burst light curve simulator
tools.detailed_description: A package to simulate Gamma-Ray Burst (GRB) light curves and spectral data within a cosmological context for instrument response modeling.

tools.name: SphericalFourierBesselDecompositions.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia package for cosmological Spherical Fourier-Bessel (SFB) analysis
tools.detailed_description: A code designed for performing Spherical Fourier-Bessel decompositions, a technique used in cosmology to analyze large-scale structures in spherical coordinates, particularly for galaxy surveys.

tools.name: MaCaw
tools.one_line_profile: MOOSE-based application for domain-decomposed neutral particle transport
tools.detailed_description: A simulation tool leveraging the MOOSE framework for unstructured mesh tracking and OpenMC for collision physics to perform neutral particle transport calculations.

tools.name: pyICs
tools.one_line_profile: Initial conditions creator for isolated galaxy formation simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to generate initial conditions for N-body/SPH simulations of isolated galaxy formation, facilitating the setup of astrophysical dynamics studies.

tools.name: cubep3m
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance cosmological N-body simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A cosmological N-body code that uses a P3M (Particle-Particle-Particle-Mesh) algorithm to simulate the evolution of large-scale structure in the universe.

tools.name: nbody2d
tools.one_line_profile: 2D Particle-Mesh N-body code for cosmology
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based 2D N-body simulation code using the Particle-Mesh (PM) method, designed for educational or lightweight cosmological dynamics studies.

tools.name: libpme6
tools.one_line_profile: Smooth Particle-Mesh Ewald algorithm implementation
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library implementing the Smooth Particle-Mesh Ewald (SPME) algorithm for calculating long-range dispersive forces in particle simulations.

tools.name: CONCEPT
tools.one_line_profile: COsmological N-body CodE in PyThon
tools.detailed_description: A massively parallel cosmological N-body simulation code written in Python, designed for ease of use and modification while maintaining performance for large-scale structure simulations.

tools.name: 21cmFirstCLASS
tools.one_line_profile: Consistent initial conditions generator for 21cmFAST using CLASS
tools.detailed_description: An extension of 21cmFAST that interfaces with the Boltzmann solver CLASS to generate initial conditions at recombination consistent with the input cosmological model.

tools.name: ParallelSfM
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Structure from Motion for Large-scale UAV Images
tools.detailed_description: A tool for generating 3D structures from large-scale UAV imagery using an anchor-free parallel merging strategy, applicable in geoscience and remote sensing.

tools.name: cola_halo
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel COLA cosmological simulation and halo finder
tools.detailed_description: A code combining parallel COLA (COmoving Lagrangian Acceleration) simulation, 2LPT initial condition generation, and Friends-of-Friends (FoF) halo finding for fast cosmological structure generation.

tools.name: sidm-nbody
tools.one_line_profile: Monte Carlo N-body Simulation for Self-Interacting Dark Matter
tools.detailed_description: An N-body simulation code that includes Monte Carlo scattering to model Self-Interacting Dark Matter (SIDM) physics.

tools.name: DarkRayNet
tools.one_line_profile: Neural networks for cosmic ray antiproton simulations
tools.detailed_description: A tool using neural networks to accelerate simulations of cosmic ray antiproton propagation for dark matter annihilation models.

tools.name: eagleSqlTools
tools.one_line_profile: Python API for the EAGLE cosmological simulation database
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for querying and interacting with the public SQL database of the EAGLE cosmological hydrodynamical simulations.

tools.name: jax-pme
tools.one_line_profile: Particle-Mesh Ewald calculations in JAX
tools.detailed_description: A JAX-based implementation of Particle-Mesh Ewald (PME) for computing long-range interactions, enabling differentiable physics simulations in cosmology and molecular dynamics.

tools.name: torch-pme
tools.one_line_profile: Particle-Mesh Ewald calculations in PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based implementation of Particle-Mesh Ewald (PME) for long-range interaction calculations, supporting differentiable physics applications.

tools.name: MicroMesh
tools.one_line_profile: Microstructure-based finite element mesh generator
tools.detailed_description: A toolset to generate finite element meshes with particle interface features derived from microstructural data, used in materials science simulations.

tools.name: Tycho 2
tools.one_line_profile: Neutral particle transport mini-app for unstructured 3D meshes
tools.detailed_description: A mini-app designed to study the performance of sweep algorithms on unstructured, 3D tetrahedral meshes for neutral particle transport, developed by Los Alamos National Laboratory.

tools.name: JAXtronomy
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based differentiable gravitational lensing simulation library
tools.detailed_description: A JAX port of the lenstronomy package, enabling parallelized, GPU-accelerated, and differentiable gravitational lensing and image simulations for cosmological inference.

tools.name: AbacusCosmos
tools.one_line_profile: Suite of cosmological N-body simulations and manipulation tools
tools.detailed_description: A collection of high-performance cosmological N-body simulations and associated Python tools for reading and manipulating the simulation data products.

tools.name: Axion-Gadget
tools.one_line_profile: N-body simulation code for Fuzzy Dark Matter
tools.detailed_description: A modified version of the Gadget2 N-body simulation code tailored for performing Fuzzy Dark Matter (Axion) simulations in a cosmological context.

tools.name: MGmol
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable O(N) First-Principles Molecular Dynamics code
tools.detailed_description: A scalable, linear-scaling First-Principles Molecular Dynamics code capable of performing large-scale electronic structure calculations and atomistic simulations.

tools.name: PyWIMPs
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for dark matter direct detection simulation and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit designed for simulating and analyzing data related to the direct detection of Weakly Interacting Massive Particles (WIMPs).

tools.name: pysco
tools.one_line_profile: Cosmological N-body code with modified gravity theories
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based cosmological N-body simulation code that incorporates various modified gravity theories for studying structure formation.

tools.name: RAMSES
tools.one_line_profile: Code for modeling astrophysical systems with self-gravity and fluid dynamics
tools.detailed_description: An open-source code for simulating astrophysical systems, featuring self-gravitating, magnetized, compressible, radiative fluid flows using Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR).

tools.name: OpenFPM
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable framework for particle and particle-mesh codes
tools.detailed_description: A scalable open C++ framework designed to simplify the development of particle and particle-mesh codes for parallel computers.

tools.name: UltraDark.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Simulations of cosmological scalar fields
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for performing simulations of cosmological scalar fields, particularly relevant for Fuzzy Dark Matter and similar models.

tools.name: Nyx
tools.one_line_profile: High-fidelity astrodynamics toolkit for orbit propagation and mission analysis
tools.detailed_description: Nyx is a high-fidelity, fast, reliable, and validated astrodynamics toolkit library written in Rust. It provides functionality for orbit propagation, spacecraft mission analysis, and trajectory design, suitable for both research and engineering applications in space science.

tools.name: osyris
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization and analysis utility for RAMSES astrophysical simulation data
tools.detailed_description: Osyris is a lightweight Python visualization and analysis library designed specifically for reading and plotting data from the RAMSES astrophysical simulation code. It allows users to easily load mesh and particle data, create histograms, and generate 2D maps of physical quantities.

tools.name: TreeFrog
tools.one_line_profile: Halo Merger Tree builder and catalog comparator for N-body simulations
tools.detailed_description: TreeFrog is a software tool developed to construct Halo Merger Trees from cosmological N-body simulations. It links halos across different time steps to trace their evolution and can also be used to cross-compare halo catalogs produced by different halo finders.

tools.name: VELOCIraptor-STF
tools.one_line_profile: Phase-space halo finder for cosmological N-body simulations
tools.detailed_description: VELOCIraptor-STF (Structure Finder) is a massively parallel galaxy/halo finder that operates in 6D phase space. It is designed to identify substructures in large-scale N-body simulations, capable of handling billions of particles and identifying halos, subhalos, and tidal streams.

tools.name: GIZMO
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-method massively parallel code for astrophysical fluid dynamics and gravity
tools.detailed_description: GIZMO is a flexible, massively parallel, multi-physics simulation code. It features multiple fluid dynamics solvers, including Meshless Finite Mass (MFM), Meshless Finite Volume (MFV), and SPH, coupled with a Tree-PM gravity solver. It is widely used for simulating galaxy formation, star formation, and cosmology.

tools.name: ramsesGPU
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-optimized version of the RAMSES astrophysics MHD simulation code
tools.detailed_description: ramsesGPU is a port of the RAMSES code tailored for large clusters of GPUs. It performs Magnetohydrodynamic (MHD) simulations for astrophysics, leveraging GPU acceleration to handle high-resolution grids and complex physical processes efficiently.

tools.name: genetIC
tools.one_line_profile: Initial conditions generator for cosmological zoom simulations
tools.detailed_description: genetIC is a code for generating initial conditions for cosmological simulations, specifically designed for 'genetic' modifications to study the response of galaxy formation to changes in the initial field. It works with the pynbody framework.

tools.name: tangos
tools.one_line_profile: Database and management system for analyzing numerical galaxy simulations
tools.detailed_description: Tangos (The Agile Numerical Galaxy Organisation System) is a python framework for building and querying databases of halo properties and merger trees from cosmological simulations. It facilitates the analysis of multi-timestep simulation data by providing a structured way to access and link galaxy properties.

tools.name: cora
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation code for 21cm Intensity Mapping skies and foregrounds
tools.detailed_description: cora is a Python package for simulating the radio sky for 21cm intensity mapping experiments. It includes models for galactic and extragalactic foregrounds as well as the cosmological 21cm signal, aiding in the design and analysis of radio telescopes.

tools.name: draco
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis and simulation pipeline for drift scan radio data
tools.detailed_description: draco is a pipeline framework for processing and analyzing data from drift scan radio telescopes (like CHIME). It handles tasks ranging from simulation of instrument response to the reduction of real observational data.

tools.name: gaepsi
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization toolkit for GADGET2 and other cosmological simulations
tools.detailed_description: gaepsi is a visualization library designed for handling large-scale cosmological simulation data, particularly from GADGET2. It provides tools for rendering particles and fields, facilitating the visual inspection and presentation of N-body simulation results.

tools.name: ramses-package
tools.one_line_profile: R Package for Data-Driven Antimicrobial Stewardship & Surveillance
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed for the analysis and surveillance of antimicrobial usage and resistance data in hospital settings, supporting data-driven stewardship.

tools.name: RAMSES
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive Mesh Refinement code for astrophysical simulations
tools.detailed_description: A widely used code for simulating the evolution of the universe, galaxy formation, and star formation using Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) techniques. It solves the Euler equations with gravity and other physical processes.

tools.name: Inflation.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Numerical evaluation of cosmic inflation models in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for solving the transport equations for perturbations in cosmic inflation models, supporting arbitrary fields and metrics.

tools.name: clustep
tools.one_line_profile: Initial conditions generator for galaxy cluster halo simulations
tools.detailed_description: A tool to generate initial conditions for galaxy cluster halo simulations, compatible with GADGET2 and RAMSES formats.

tools.name: galstep
tools.one_line_profile: Initial conditions generator for spiral galaxy simulations
tools.detailed_description: A tool to generate initial conditions for spiral galaxy simulations, supporting GADGET2, RAMSES, and HDF5 formats.

tools.name: RAMSES-yOMP
tools.one_line_profile: Performance optimized version of the RAMSES code
tools.detailed_description: A modified version of the RAMSES astrophysical simulation code, featuring performance optimizations (likely OpenMP related) for better efficiency.

tools.name: rur
tools.one_line_profile: Ramses Universal Reader for simulation data analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to read and process data from RAMSES simulations, facilitating analysis and visualization.

tools.name: PICSP
tools.one_line_profile: Particle-in-Cell Simulation of Plasma on structured mesh
tools.detailed_description: An open-source scientific program for simulating plasmas using the Particle-In-Cell (PIC) method on a structured mesh.

tools.name: fake_spectra
tools.one_line_profile: Generator of fake spectra from cosmological simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python code to generate synthetic absorption spectra from cosmological hydrodynamical simulations, used for comparing simulations with observational data.

tools.name: bskit
tools.one_line_profile: Bispectrum measurement tool for cosmological simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit for measuring bispectra from cosmological simulation snapshots, useful for analyzing non-Gaussianity and large-scale structure.

tools.name: paltas
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation-based inference for strong gravitational lensing
tools.detailed_description: A package for conducting simulation-based inference on strong gravitational lensing systems, generating realistic lensing datasets for training ML models.

tools.name: paicos
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis package for Arepo cosmological simulations
tools.detailed_description: An object-oriented Python package designed for the analysis and visualization of cosmological simulations performed with the Arepo code.

tools.name: MachineLearning-CFD-DEM
tools.one_line_profile: ML-enhanced drag prediction for CFD-DEM simulations
tools.detailed_description: A runtime Artificial Neural Network (ANN) integration for CFDEM/OpenFOAM to predict drag forces, boosting the fidelity of coarse-mesh CFD-DEM simulations.

tools.name: DaMaSCUS
tools.one_line_profile: Dark Matter Simulation Code for Underground Scatterings
tools.detailed_description: A Monte Carlo simulation code to model the scattering of dark matter particles as they travel through the Earth to underground detectors.

tools.name: DaMaSCUS-CRUST
tools.one_line_profile: DaMaSCUS edition for crustal scattering simulations
tools.detailed_description: A specialized version of the DaMaSCUS code focused on simulating dark matter scattering within the Earth's crust.

tools.name: DaMaSCUS-SUN
tools.one_line_profile: DaMaSCUS edition for solar scattering simulations
tools.detailed_description: A specialized version of the DaMaSCUS code focused on simulating dark matter scattering and transport within the Sun.

tools.name: maria
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation tools for ground-based millimeter and sub-millimeter wave observatories
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to simulate the observations of ground-based millimeter and sub-millimeter wave telescopes, aiding in the design and analysis of astronomical experiments.

tools.name: dmdd
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation and Bayesian analysis for dark matter direct detection
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for simulating nuclear-recoil data and performing Bayesian posterior analysis for dark matter direct detection experiments, supporting various dark matter-nucleon interaction theories.

tools.name: SPECTRUM
tools.one_line_profile: Space Plasma and Energetic Charged particle TRansport on Unstructured Meshes
tools.detailed_description: A C++ code for simulating the transport of energetic charged particles and space plasma on unstructured meshes, suitable for astrophysical and space physics applications.

tools.name: arepy
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis tool for Arepo cosmological simulation outputs
tools.detailed_description: A Python module specifically designed for reading, processing, and analyzing output files and snapshots from the Arepo moving-mesh cosmological simulation code.

tools.name: ElectrostaticRepulsionMesher
tools.one_line_profile: Particle distribution generator based on image fields
tools.detailed_description: A tool that generates particle distributions and associated Delaunay triangulations based on grayscale image fields using electrostatic repulsion principles, useful for mesh generation in simulations.

tools.name: Gadget4-Simba
tools.one_line_profile: Cosmological N-body/SPH simulation code (Simba flavor)
tools.detailed_description: A repository for the Gadget4-Simba cosmological simulation code, used for large-scale structure and galaxy formation simulations involving N-body and hydrodynamics.

tools.name: AnastrisTNG
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis pipeline for IllustrisTNG cosmological simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for processing and analyzing data from the IllustrisTNG cosmological magnetohydrodynamical simulations.

tools.name: LSASSfM
tools.one_line_profile: Large-Scale Ambiguous Scene Structure from Motion
tools.detailed_description: A C implementation for Large-Scale Ambiguous Scene Structure from Motion (SfM), a technique used in computer vision and photogrammetry for 3D reconstruction from 2D images.

tools.name: ytree
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis of merger trees from cosmological simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for loading and analyzing merger tree data from various cosmological simulation formats (Amiga Halo Finder, Rockstar, Consistent-Trees, etc.).

tools.name: sisl
tools.one_line_profile: Electronic structure analysis and transport calculations
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for manipulating and analyzing electronic structure data, and performing large-scale tight-binding DFT and NEGF transport calculations.

tools.name: InteractionGraphNet
tools.one_line_profile: Deep graph learning for protein-ligand interaction prediction
tools.detailed_description: A deep graph representation learning framework (InteractionGraphNet) for accurate protein-ligand interaction prediction and large-scale structure-based virtual screening in drug discovery.
